title: Typeface used in 100% Design logo
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317160803im_/http:/typophile.com/files/typeface_6014.jpg)

I can't seem to find a typeface like this. The characters are almost round and ‘s’ is quite wide comparing to other characters.

Font: 

 Chalet Book (Bold), modified 

Solved By: 

 [fvilanakis](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317160803/http:/typophile.com/user/176276 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [typeface.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317160803/http:/typophile.com/files/typeface_25.jpg) | 45.68 KB |
author: Agnese

comments.content:
I can't find a perfect match either. Some similar:  
 **[Questrial](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317160803/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Google-Web-Fonts&ffam=Questrial%20-%20Regular&fid=7adde1c3fcd35773381765f733f78f20&fsize=60&text=IOO%25%20design%20singapore&wrap=2)** by Admix Designs (2011) now part of Google Web Fonts  
 **[Chalet Book (Bold)](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317160803/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=House-Industries&ffam=ChaletBook%20-%20Bold&fid=09ecf9ea0f2216241889b9ecc0cbc615&fsize=60&text=design&fit=1)** by House Industries
Mixing the [Chalet](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317160803/http:/www.houseind.com/fonts/chalet) should do the job perfectly.
Thank you for the help! It really looks like a modified version of Chalet Book.
